*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Elias R. Wightman, October 14, 1830. Instructions for surveying.
A*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr E. R. Weightman*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*you can survey a quarter for *person_mentioned*G. W. Cock*/person_mentioned* on a *location_mentioned*Post oak Bayou west of Trespalacios*/location_mentioned*—not to cross any *location_mentioned*tide or large creek*/location_mentioned*—be attentive to that rule*/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="10-14-1830">Octr. 14, 1830*/date_mentioned* *person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*If any *location_mentioned*creek */location_mentioned*is crossed the tract must be narrower than long, and the narrowest front must be *location_mentioned*on the creek,*/location_mentioned* that is that tract can neither be run square or oblong up and down the *location_mentioned*creek */location_mentioned*for if it crosses it will have two fronts one on each side, you must use your discretion as to crossing the *location_mentioned*creek*/location_mentioned*, so as not to spoil another *location_mentioned*tract*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
